conclusion: Examine velocity-time graphs to determine when objects are farthest apart.
Object A has constant velocity until time t2; Object B's velocity decreases, then increases to meet A at t2.
Determine when positions of objects are most different.
At time t1, object A has moved a certain distance with constant velocity.
At time t1, object B is closer to the origin than object A.
As time progresses to t2, object B reaches the same velocity as object A.
At time t2, both objects have traveled the same distance from the starting point.
Distance between objects is minimized at time t2.
Objects are farthest apart before they meet, specifically at time t1.
